title: Can the Cass situation from today be the beginning of a trend?
body:
For the unaware, an accidental and experimental Cass update was pushed to the PBE today. [Repertoire already made a comment about it:](https://www.reddit.com/r/leagueoflegends/comments/4byi37/cassiopeia_update_news/d1dipoe)

>Hi all,
>Cassiopeia's update did go to the PBE today by accident, but what you see is representative of the direction for the mid season update. It will be gone from the PBE after this weekend, so if you want to check it out and play it until then, have a blast. Also, don't freak about numbers and stuff yet. She's still an unfinished product.

I'm not going to mark this as some massive change or some paradigm shift in League's design cycle because, as it's said, this was an accident. However, this COULD be the start of something fantastic.

Small, controlled weekend tests could give Riot some valuable info on directions and where things are going. In fact this playtest could actually tell people what works for a kit and what doesn't, saving valuable man-hours on remaking particles and ability icons simply by seeing if the new ability will feel nice. It gives mains/players a feeling on what champions are being aimed for and, overall, it's possibly an amazing tool to give Riot feedback without worrying about what is clearly not done.

Part of the issue with champ reworks/updates is that we don't get to touch them until they're done and done. We couldn't give feedback on new Fiora until she was finished. We had to wait for Garen/Skarner/Morde/Darius to be out before we touched them. So on. This could be an amazing tool to solve feedback right away and give some better insight when it comes to developing a champ update.

Riot certainly doesn't have to do this but I sincerely hope they're monitoring this weekend and the feedback Cass gets. If this all goes well, this could be beneficial to absolutely EVERYONE involved. Players, Riot and otherwise.

replies.body:
This would certainly allow Riot to gather valuable information on how a champion "feels" and if they do live up to their champ identity.

Hopefully the forst of many of these "accidental leaks"
I bet you wish they pushed the Morde rework a month earlier so you could start telling them about things they were doing wrong before they thought they were finished.
1 hit Q's were not fun. how it even made it live i will never know
It never was 1 hit , it was a 3 hit combo on his Q.
It was a "3 hit combo", but with the ratios on release Morde could use the first two hits on minions then flash and 100-0 somebody with just the third hit.

She has become too mainstream and low-counterplay. What I like in the rework is her new superb splitpush potential. I can sometimes win 4v5 by splitting correctly

Except they asked for input for the changes at the beginning of the year and most of the commentary was whining that "Vel'Koz is perfect. Leave him alone" and "Why aren't Syndra/Swain/etc being changed instead?

I personally like Riot asking for input, and I gave suggestions at the time, but most of the people on the boards are unhelpful and just whine about changes instead of trying to help.
So then they can actually try these changes and provide feedback based on the changes?

Actually there was plenty of constructive feedback on those posts....

Granted I really only payed attention to Cass, but still xD
I didn't see the threads, but knowing this community, specifically the boards, I believe it.
They said they wouldn't do that because they're afraid people will get attached to kits or ideas that they deem to be mistakes

That's an absolutely terrible reason. Ideas that are liked/loved can reappear and return in the form of other characters/kits/etc.

Just because someone likes it doesn't mean it's too good to be removed.

Given their laughable track record of creating expectations and then having it blow up in their faces, I can understand their stance on this

They're just making sure we can't hold anything against them

Difference there is that "We're testing something new" versus "We promise that XYZ is coming soon".

Ao Shin would fall into this category. Testing a WIP kit is not.

And Riot's obvious (and tbh well deserved) response would be that many of their players have not demonstrated the ability to see the difference between Ao Shin and a WIP kit

Look, I don't agree with their decision, but from their point of view it makes total sense

If there was better communication on announced characters and reworked kits even if they are currently Works In Progress, this should reduce that confusion. But what can you expect when they show off some sweet dragon concept with a name and everything, then spend 3 years saying "It'll come out soon"

At least they've expressed that champion reworks for Taric and Yorick are in the pipeline just behind other champions, and hopefully they don't end up with another Ranked Dominion situation cause that breeds a certain kind of hate.
I honestly think that the machine gun kit of Cassiopeia should be given to Urgot, his kit is somewhat similar. I really want Cassiopeia to be a poison mage.
I want Urgot's rework to basically turn him into Metal Gear.
I don't know what "turn him into Metal Gear" could possibly entail, but now I want it, too
I want him to be a mobile artillery platform. Kog'maw is a gatling gun, so I want to see Urgot become the mobile missile launcher, a slow moving, projectile launching death machine.
To be fair, he already has the slow moving and the projectile launching down.
Exactly. I want to see something like them having his ult have him launch a bunch of missiles that he can control like a Sion ult.
I love everything about this idea.

She is a strong poison mage now, her Q deals alot more damage, her W might change because it feels the same, her E change will definitely make people max Q now. E is like a small "helper" for your damage with the poisoned target, and ult is the same.

all fingers crossed he wont fk up cassiopeia (its not fun that he is work on another champ i like to play), her changes doesnt seem that bad (except for denying her {{item:3020}} , there goes some mpen away)

You lose 15 mpen for probably 100+ ability power which is a fair trade imho, it just takes longer to scale. However, with 6 items you can hold off on your BIG purchase items for later and go for better early items (Death cap and crew can wait longer).

Before we had nothing to prevent them dashing then CC, which also countered everything, but now we finally have something to ruin those assassins life.
